title: OPBC Exam
description: Students who wish to earn an Oregon Procurement Basic Certification must pass this exam with a score of 80 percent or better and earn 75 contact hours in coursework.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: OPAC Exam
description: Students who wish to earn an Oregon Procurement Intermediate Certification must pass this exam with a score of 80 percent or better and earn 175 contact hours in coursework.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: OPIC Exam
description: Students who wish to earn an Oregon Procurement Intermediate Certification must pass this exam with a score of 80 percent or better and earn 125 contact hours in coursework.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Fundamentals of Sustanable Procurement (Day 2 of 2)
description: This class will focus on procuring goods and services in a sustainable and green manner in accordance with the Oregon Sustainability Act of 2001. Topics related to sustainable procurement will be discussed.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Principles of Public Procurement WEBINAR (Day 8 of 8)
description: This course is designed to provide instruction in conducting procurements that are between $10,000-$150,000 and greater and provide a foundational overview for anyone new to Oregon public procurement.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Fundamentals of Sustanable Procurement (Day 1 of 2)
description: This class will focus on procuring goods and services in a sustainable and green manner in accordance with the Oregon Sustainability Act of 2001. Topics related to sustainable procurement will be discussed.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Principles of Public Procurement WEBINAR (Day 2 of 8)
description: This course is designed to provide instruction in conducting procurements that are between $10,000-$150,000 and greater and provide a foundational overview for anyone new to Oregon public procurement.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Writing a Statement of Work
description: This course will help you determine how to improve your statement of work. It will also provide writing tips, pointers on the use of terms such as shall-must-may-will, and steps in writing.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Principles of Public Procurement WEBINAR (Day 1 of 8)
description: This course is designed to provide instruction in conducting procurements that are between $10,000-$150,000 and greater and provide a foundational overview for anyone new to Oregon public procurement.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Fundamentals of Procurement ($10,000 to $150,000) WEBINAR (Day 3 of 4)
description: Students will learn about available resources and tools to ultimately arrive at “best value” in public contracting.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Fundamentals of Procurement ($10,000 to $150,000) WEBINAR (Day 2 of 4)
description: Students will learn about available resources and tools to ultimately arrive at “best value” in public contracting.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Fundamentals of Procurement ($10,000 to $150,000) WEBINAR (Day 1 of 4)
description: Students will learn about available resources and tools to ultimately arrive at “best value” in public contracting.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Demystifying Terms and Conditions
description: Learn about standard terms and conditions typically used in contracts. The course provides an opportunity to ask questions you always wanted answered about both standard and special terms and conditions.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Using Statewide Price Agreements
description: This course will help procurement professionals under DAS Authority learn how to use statewide price agreements. This course will not go over how to search in OregonBuys.  Please see Workday Learning for full course description.

title: Small Procurements
description: This course explores the method and procedure for conducting a Small Procurement (up to $10,000) in accordance with Oregon Revised Statute and Oregon Administrative Rules. Topics covered include procurement authority, sourcing methods, and procurement thresholds.

description: Students who wish to earn an Oregon Procurement Intermediate Certification must pass this exam with a score of 80 percent or better and earn 125 contact hours in coursework.  Please see iLearn for full course description.

title: Principles of Public Procurement WEBINAR (Day 8 of 8)
description: This course is designed to provide instruction in conducting procurements that are between $10,000-$150,000 and greater and provide a foundational overview for anyone new to Oregon public procurement.  Please see iLearn for full course description.

title: Market Research in Public Procurement (Day 2 of 2)
description: Students will learn about available resources and tools to ultimately arrive at “best value” in public contracting.  Please see iLearn for full course description.

description: This course is designed to provide instruction in conducting procurements that are between $10,000-$150,000 and greater and provide a foundational overview for anyone new to Oregon public procurement.  Please see iLearn for full course description.

title: Fundamentals of Procurement ($10,000 to $150,000) WEBINAR (Day 4 of 4)
description: This interactive class will focus on procuring goods and services between $10,000 and $150,000 with emphasis on statutory requirements and best practices. Please see iLearn for full course description.

title: Fundamentals of Procurement ($10,000 to $150,000) WEBINAR (Day 3 of 4)
description: This interactive class will focus on procuring goods and services between $10,000 and $150,000 with emphasis on statutory requirements and best practices. Please see iLearn for full course description.

title: Fundamentals of Procurement ($10,000 to $150,000) WEBINAR (Day 1 of 4)
description: This interactive class will focus on procuring goods and services between $10,000 and $150,000 with emphasis on statutory requirements and best practices. Please see iLearn for full course description.

title: Writing a Statement of Work
description: This course will help you determine how to improve your statement of work. It will also provide writing tips, pointers on the use of terms such as shall-must-may-will, and steps in writing.  Please see iLearn for full course description.

title: Demystifying Terms and Conditions
description: Learn about standard terms and conditions typically used in contracts. The course provides an opportunity to ask questions you always wanted answered about both standard and special terms and conditions.  Please see iLearn for full course description.

title: Small Procurements
description: This course explores the method and procedure for conducting a Small Procurement (up to $10,000) in accordance with Oregon Revised Statute and Oregon Administrative Rules. Topics covered include procurement authority, sourcing methods, and procurement thresholds.

title: Using Statewide Price Agreements
description: This course will help procurement professionals under DAS Authority learn how to use statewide price agreements. This course will not go over how to search in ORPIN.  Please see iLearn for full course description.
